subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|grade=c|rs=彳08}}

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
Prefix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|prefix|お}}

# ''indicates that the [word] is [[honorific]]''; often used to indicate that the [word] belongs or is related to the [[listener]] {{gl|as opposed to the [[speaker]]}}

subSections.title: Derived terms
Usage notes
subSections.text:
{{also|w:Honorific speech in Japanese#Honorific prefixes}}
Not to be confused with {{m|ja|大|tr=ō-||[[great]]}}, which is a less-commonly used prefix.

Almost exclusively written in hiragana, to disambiguate with the heteronyms below.

Prefixed to the native Japanese words, as in {{m|ja|御水|tr=o-mizu||[[water]]}} (words read with {{m|ja|訓読み|tr=kun'yomi}}). However, there are numerous exceptions such as {{m|ja|お電話|tr=o-denwa}}. In old use, prefixed short women's names regardless of the type of reading, for example {{m|ja|お菊|tr=o-Kiku}}, {{m|ja|おしん|tr=o-Shin}}, {{m|ja|お妙|tr=o-Tae}}, etc. For {{m|ja|外来語|tr=gairaigo||(non-Chinese) foreign loan words}}, this prefix is seldom used, but somewhat preferred in the jargon of some kinds of industry, as in {{m|ja|おビール|tr=o-bīru||[[beer]]}}.

Usage varies between speakers, situations, and gender – more polite speech, especially by women, features more use of this prefix, while blunt speech, especially by men, uses it less or not at all (words where the prefix has become mandatory are replaced by blunter terms that do not have the prefix). In rare cases a prefixed term has become impolite, as in {{m|ja|御前|tr=omae||you (familiar or derogatory)}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
Prefix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|prefix|おん}}

# ''indicates that the [word] is [[honorific]]''; often used to indicate that the [word] belongs or is related to the [[listener]] {{gl|as opposed to the [[speaker]]}}

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 3
Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|大御}}

subSections.title: Prefix
Derived terms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|御%時|おおん%とき}}
* {{ja-r|御%身|おおん%み}}

subSections.title: Etymology 4
Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{s|honorific emphasizing beauty}} {{ja-l|美}}, {{ja-l|深}}

subSections.title: Prefix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|prefix|み}}

# {{lb|ja|honorific|archaic}} ''added to [[god]]s and other [[spiritual]]ly [[important]] things''
# {{lb|ja|honorific|archaic}} ''added to [[nouns]] to indicate [[godlike]] [[respect]]''
# {{lb|ja|honorific|archaic}} ''added to [[placename]]s to emphasize [[beauty]]''

subSections.title: Derived terms
Usage notes
subSections.text:
{{also|w:Honorific speech in Japanese#Honorific prefixes}}
Primarily for the religious words, pertaining to gods or the emperor, as in {{m|ja|御輿|tr=mikoshi||[[portable]] [[shrine]]}}. However, in this context it is often replaced by {{ja-l|神}} ("god", also pronounced ''mi-''), and then a further {{ja-l||御|o-}} may be added, as in {{m|ja|御神輿|tr=o-mikoshi}}. The ''mi-'' prefix also became merged into other kanji, as in {{m|ja|宮|tr=miya||[[imperial]] [[palace]]}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 5
Prefix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|prefix|ご}}

# ''indicates that the [word] is [[honorific]]''; often used to indicate that the [word] belongs or is related to the [[listener]] {{gl|as opposed to the [[speaker]]}}

subSections.title: Derived terms
Usage notes
Etymology 6
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=goon|ご}}

Short form of {{m|ja|御前|tr=gozen||[[noble]] [[person]]}}.

subSections.title: Suffix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|suffix|ご}}

# {{lb|ja|honorific}} ''indicates that the [word] is familiar to the speaker and slight [[honorific]]''

Derived terms

subSections.title: Etymology 7
Alternative forms

Derived terms

subSections.title: Prefix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|prefix|ぎょ}}

# ''prefixed to make a [[honorific]] kanji compound, especially used to indicate that the [word] belongs or is related to the emperor and/or the equivalents''

subSections.title: Derived terms
Suffix
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|suffix|ぎょ}}

# ''suffixed to make a [[honorific]] kanji compound which means the action belongs or is related to the emperor and/or the equivalents''
